‘Beyond the Book author’ interviews

This page contains a set of 'Beyond The Book' interviews conducted with several children's authors by our 2015-16 Literacy Ambassador, Matt Shenton, during his tenure.

Each author has been asked the same set of questions, making the interviews well-suited to comparison activities. Alternatively, they might be used as an introduction to new authors and books for both teachers and pupils.

Go Beyond the Book to solve a crime!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Oct 4, 2016

Come with us as we investigate how the scales of justice can be manipulated in a thrilling new YA book.

Go Beyond the Book to visit a drowned world!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Sep 14, 2016

Discover a dark and flooded world where warring factions fight to survive and go 'Beyond the Book' with Francesca Armour-Chelu, author of Fenn Halflin and the Fearzero.

Go Beyond the Book with Polly Ho-Yen

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jul 19, 2016

Come with us on a journey to tower blocks and mysterious lochs as we go 'Beyond the Book' with an author who will terrify you, yet make you feel all warm inside at the same time.

Go Beyond the Book and Celebrate the 2016 Carnegie Medal

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jun 16, 2016

The 2016 Carnegie Medal will be announced on Monday 20 June. To celebrate, go Beyond the Book with the 2015 winner Tanya Landman!

Come 'Beyond the Beetle' with us!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published May 3, 2016

Come ‘Beyond the Book’ and meet Darkus and Baxter in the amazing Beetle Boy by M.G. Leonard. Warning: contains a bucket load of laughs and amazing beetles!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with a Lollie nominee!

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Mar 24, 2016

Come 'Beyond the Book' and meet Emily Sparkes as she tries to make sense of the mayhem around her. She will make you cry with laughter!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with a stunning debut novel

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Mar 2, 2016

Once a year, Teva separates into two, leaving a younger version of herself stuck at the same age. Dive into the astonishing world of 'More of Me'.

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ and back in time

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jan 29, 2016

We travel through time and space to visit ancient Crete in a brilliant retelling of the Minotaur myth. Warning: The Double Axe is not for the faint-hearted!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the new master of dark fiction

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jan 15, 2016

Author William Hussey is in a bit of a pickle. How can a murderer escape from a locked room without using the door or windows? Find out by going 'Beyond the Book'!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with Chris Priestley

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Jan 4, 2016

We start 2016 with a bang by going 'Beyond the Book' with the author of our favorite book of 2015!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of The World of Norm

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Dec 17, 2015

Ever get the feeling you've been cheated? Or have you ever been tempted to shave a dog? If so, The World of Norm might just be for you!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of Sophie Someone

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Dec 9, 2015

Meet Hayley Long — Suffolk born author of the Costa Award nominated Sophie Someone and soothsayer!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of Undead Pets

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Dec 2, 2015

Joe Edmunds is a modern Dr Dolittle. Except the animals he talks to are dead! Find out more and meet the author of Undead Pets, Sam Hay.

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of Boyface and the Tartan Badger

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Nov 23, 2015

Come with us as we go into the strange world of Boyface and the Tartan Badger by James Campbell.

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of Stonebird

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Nov 17, 2015

We review the exceptional Stonebird and find out what's on author Mike Revell's bookshelf!

Go ‘Beyond the Book’ with the author of Cowgirl

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Nov 9, 2015

We have a look at the very funny Cowgirl and its author G.R. Gemin goes 'Beyond the Book' by answering some of our questions!
